document.heading: Authorization for Medical Consent for Children in the Care of Adults Other than Parents Temporary Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-264, the “Authorization for Medical Consent for Children in the Care of Adults Other than Parents Temporary Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-752. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 15, 1992, and January 5, 1993, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 26, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 9-412 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-264 became effective on March 27, 1993.
